metadata.title: CVE-2019-11707 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
A type confusion vulnerability can occur when manipulating JavaScriptobjects due to issues in Array.pop. This can allow for an exploitablecrash. We are aware of targeted attacks in the wild abusing this flaw. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.7.1, Firefox < 67.0.3, andThunderbird < 60.7.2.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11707` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 67.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 67.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 67.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 67.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:60.7.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-globalmenu - 1:60.7.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:60.7.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:60.7.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-testsuite - 1:60.7.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:60.7.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:60.7.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:60.7.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '67.0.3+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:60.7.2+build1-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
